required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue in the Thighs Using High Intensity Focused Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Treatment of Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue in the Thighs Using the Liposonix System (Model 2)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of treatment with the Liposonix System (Model 2) for the circumferential reduction of subcutaneous adipose tissue (SAT) of the thighs.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects received a single treatment (Liposonix System) on one randomly assigned thigh. The opposite thigh was not treated and served as a control for each subject.

primary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement measured by change from baseline thigh circumference after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Showing Clinical Improvement Using the Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) Post Treatment, Assessed by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator improvement at 12 weeks using the GAIS Scale, as presented based on percentage of subjects showing improvement. Outcome presented in % of participants that had GAIS scores of either 4 (improved) or 5 (much improved) at 12 weeks post treatment. *GAIS Scale: 1=Much Worse, 2=Worse, 3=No Improvement, 4=Improved, 5=Much Improved
Likert scale ranges from 1=Very Dissatisfied to 4=satisfied, 5=very satisfied. Percentage of participants rated 4 and 5 are reported below
Discomfort level during treatment using the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) and post-treatment skin reponses or side effects using a 0-3 severity scale.
Ultrasound assisted measurement of adipose tissue thickness

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) Score Post Treatment Assessed by Investigator for Determining Clinical Improvement
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Investigator improvement at 12 weeks using the GAIS Scale. *GAIS Scale: 1=Much Worse, 2=Worse, 3=No Improvement, 4=Improved, 5=Much Improved

clinical_study.condition: Treatment of Adipose Tissue in the Thighs

arm_group.description: Subjects randomly received treatment of either the left or right thigh with the Liposonix System (Model 2)

intervention.description: Treatment of Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue in the thighs using High Intensity Focused Ultrasound

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects between 18-60 years of age
- Body Mass Index of ≤30 lb/in2
- Thickness of adipose tissue is at least 1.0 cm beyond the selected focal depth in the area to be treated (≥2.3cm)
- Subjects must agree not to alter their regular diet or exercise routines during the course of the study
- Subjects must be willing and able to comply with all study visit requirements, procedures, and assessments
- Subject must understand the nature of the study and sign an IRB approved Informed Consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects is pregnant
- Subjects diagnosed with a coagulation disorder or receiving anticoagulant therapy
- Subject has had prior aesthetic procedures in the area to be treated
- Subjects has pacemaker, defibrillator, or other implantable electrical device
- Subject has significant circumferential asymmetry between thighs

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigator shall notify Sponsor of the intent to publish or present independent Study Data, and agrees not to publish or publicly present and/or discuss such data, Investigator’s current findings and/or the results of the Study independently without the express written consent of Sponsor, which consent may be withheld. Sponsor reserves the right to require Investigator to remove any/all confidential information from any/all publications.
